message: I'm back working at Hum-Drum Junk. As always, it's never very busy.
You could even say it's boring. Only now, I've learned to appreciate boredom and the peace that it signifies.
This past year reminded me of many things, precious things that I'll strive to never again forget.
From time to time, new memories would surface, more bits and pieces of everything I forgot.
Whenever that happened, I would go talk to Granny. She always took the time to answer my questions.
I learned that the beach in my dreams was a real place, near to the church where Granny left me.
One day, I slipped out of the church and found my way to the shore.
And that's where I met him.
My dad.
I remember wanting desperately to leave with him. I wanted him to take me away.
Dad and I weren't related, and neither was Mom, of course.
Mom wasn't Granny's real daughter either. She'd had a complicated childhood; Granny had raised her.
Dad, meanwhile, was something of a drifter. After finding himself on the island, he met Mom and fell in love.
Dad always traveled a lot, so he never had any intention of settling down with Mom on the island.
Mom knew this going in, but insisted he take her along when it came time for him to leave.
Granny didn't trust Dad at first, since everything about him was a mystery, but that changed when she saw how he brought Mom out of her shell.
There was something about him, Granny said. Some mysterious power to touch people's hearts.
After that, Granny decided to welcome him into the family.
And if Mom was that sure about it, she would just have to trust them and see them off on their journey.
It was years before Mom and Dad came home.
...And when they did, they came with me in tow.
That was shocking enough, Granny said, but when they told her where they'd found me, at a church by the sea, she couldn't believe her ears.
But when she saw my face, she was convinced, and the people at the church confirmed it.
That was when she decided to take me in.
It must've been fate, she said. She'd left me there once, and I'd found my way back to her.
...After telling me the story, she seemed relieved.
She watched over me my whole life without ever saying a word.
Truly, I owe her everything.
I'm leaning on the counter at work, deep in thought, when the phone rings.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hello, you've reached Hum-Drum Junk."

name: ウイルス
message: "Hello? I just have a quick question. You wouldn't happen to have an Aoba working there, would you?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Uh... this is Aoba."
The voice sounds familiar...

name: ウイルス
message: "Oh, fantastic. This is Midorijima General Hospital. I'm calling to let you know that a relative of yours is currently hospitalized with us."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Huh? You mean Granny?"

name: ウイルス
message: "No. Your brother, I believe."

name: 蒼葉
message: "My... brother?"

name: ウイルス
message: "Yes. He didn't have any identification, so it took us some time to track you down."

name: ウイルス
message: "But apparently, you're his next of kin."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Uh... There has to be some kind of misunderstanding. Are you sure you have the right person?"

name: ウイルス
message: "No. It's all in order. You are Seragaki Aoba?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Oh, uh, yeah. I am."

name: ウイルス
message: "And your brother's name is Sei?"
How? Only a very few people know that name.
Hearing it sends my mind hurtling back a full year.
And before I realize it, my lips have formed the words.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Yes. My brother's name is Sei."

name: ウイルス
message: "Then there's no misunderstanding."

name: ウイルス
message: "If I might make a suggestion, why not come for a visit when it's convenient?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh, uh, yeah, good idea... I think I'll do that."

name: ウイルス
message: "Fantastic. We're looking forward to it. Have a wonderful day."
Dazed, I put down the phone and fidget in my seat.
Did that really just happen?

name: 蒼葉
message: "What the..."
Someone found Sei?
How could that be? What did they even find? His body?
Even if, by some miracle, they found his body intact in the ruins of the tower, his soul is already...
I... saw him vanish. He said he was going to end things, and that was the last I saw of him.
I lost my brother. And Ren too.
My Allmate has returned to its factory settings. I thought about retraining him, but what would be the point?
It wouldn't bring my Ren back.
The other me... Sei... Ren... All have left me.
I have my normal life back, but there's still a gaping hole in my heart.
...It can't be Sei in the hospital.
But if it's not, then why would they call me?
Did someone tell them about Sei? Who?
Or... is it really...
...Maybe it's a cruel prank, or just a misunderstanding after all.
But... I have to go see for myself. Right?
...Yeah. I recall those words from my childhood, and my worries melt away.
Even if it is a prank, who cares?
I mean...

name: 蒼葉
message: "You can always break it down and start anew."
I get permission to leave early and go home to tell Granny.
Granny is making dinner in the kitchen. When I tell her what happened, all she says is "Huh."
I can't tell what she's thinking. I assume she must harbor guilt over abandoning Sei to Toue.
But I'm sure that Sei didn't blame her for it. I don't know why... but I'm sure.
After that, I leave for the hospital. For Granny's sake too, I need to know.
